page.title: 02Little Addington House 1985
page.content: The house used to be called Little Addington Parsonage House.The newest part of the house is the honey-room and the owner,who is a bee-keeper,makes honey.A couple of years ago, the old larder was made into a toilet for many reasons! The house was built in 1862 and the Rev. A Boodle drew the plans for the house.In 1920 the house was owned by Mr Conyers,a leather merchant,who worked in Leeds. In 1928 Mr. Conyers retired, left the house and went to Raunds.Mr Cork lived there for a while but from 1928 to 1930 the house was empty. In 1938,the present owner bought the house from the ecclesiastical commissioners of England.The house has its own water supply by way of a pump so there is no problem in a drought.
